*div1 type="summary"* *p*R. C. Langdon to Francis Keller, June 28, 1825. Wants to establish a press and publish a paper in Texas. It would do much to counteract false reports in Ohio and Kentucky.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**person_mentioned*Francis Keller, Esqr*/person_mentioned*.—*/p*
*p*Dear Sir: As you are about to visit the *location_mentioned*Colony of *person_mentioned*Colonel Austin*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned*, I shall take it a particular favor if you will make enquiries respecting the prospects of establishing a printing Press in that place. Should *person_mentioned*Col. Austin*/person_mentioned* be of opinion that a well conducted Journal would aid his views and assist in peopling that interesting *location_mentioned*section of country */location_mentioned*I can remove with an entire new establishment, which I lately selected in *location_mentioned*Cincinnati*/location_mentioned*, and is at present here—The original cost, with paper sufficient for one year, and all expences of transportation from this to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, will cost not quite $1000, or at most would not exceed it.*/p*
*p*A paper established there at this period would more materially aid the improvement of that *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*than any thing I know of.—Various and erroneous opinions have gone abroad in *location_mentioned*Ohio */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Kentucky*/location_mentioned*, respecting the soil, climate, products, etc. and if a paper was printed there it would receive a wide circulation in the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned*—In *location_mentioned*Ohio*/location_mentioned*, several *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*would have moved over but for fear of the truth of what they had heard against the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*—I endeavored to do away with those impressions and promised to write to them—they are persons of easy circumstances, and respectable character, you can acquaint *person_mentioned*Col. Austin*/person_mentioned* with my situation, etc., etc.*/p*
*p*Request him to write to me on the subject—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*R. C. Langdon.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Natches*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="06-28-1825">June 28,1825*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
